intro: Licania heteromorpha var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth licania, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and lanceolate leaves with a prominent midrib. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
